job_title: Library Office Assistant in Battle Creek, MI
pros:
Very easy going and laid back
Consistent schedule every week (until class schedule changes)
cons:
Low pay for student employees
No room for promotions or raises for student employees
Only allowed to work 20 hours a week

job_title: Department Assistant in Battle Creek, MI
Graphic Designer – Support Specialist in Battle Creek, MI
pros:
– The benefits are second to none. Great health insurance, retirement options, sick leave, flexible hours for hourly employees, use of campus gym facilities, and so many other things

– Great work atmosphere. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. You definitely get that small town vibe where everyone knows everyone and you're always greeted with a smile from whoever you meet. 

– The workflow is pretty relaxed. There are a lot of projects you'll take on during the day and deadlines to meet but everyone communicates well to complete assigned tasks. I've never had to work more than 40 hours in a week so the work/social life balance is second to none.
cons:
– If you're a designer who enjoys working remotely then this might not be the place for you. During Covid, the college has allowed me to work from home but typically it is a 40 hours per week in office job. 

– There are no bonuses and your pay is pretty much locked in but it typically increases every year to match market inflation.

review_title: Adjuncts get short end of stick
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Battle Creek, MI
pros: Flexible schedules depending on your department.
cons: Most adjuncts do not know if their class will run until the week before classes start and the have already done all of the work to prep for the course for the entire semester. If their class is cancelled, they do not get paid for the time spent prepping. Nor do they qualify for unemployment because they consider it a contingent contract employment basis.

pros: Kellogg Community College is an excellent place to work.  In the seven years that I have employed as an Adjunct Faculty member, I have found the faculty and staff to be friendly, supportive, and understanding of the challenges that fact the adjunct staff.
cons: I have no negative criticisms or comments to make about Kellogg Community College.

pros: Easy to communicate with senior staff.
cons: I wish I would have been able to do more.
